newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends mixed, nearbys gain.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends mixed, nearbys gain.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures ended mixed, with nearby months gaining on a combination of mill and commercial buying, traders said.

Traders said spring wheat also gained amid bullish forecasts for Monday's USDA stocks report. An average of analysts' estimates pegged stocks as of September 1 at 1.767 billion bushels, down from 1.881 billion a year ago.

The MGE Dec/March spring wheat spread, which was at a one-cent carry earlier this week, ended at an 8-1/2-cent inverse, which traders said reflected the degree to which players were rolling hedge positions from Dec to March.
MGE spring wheat closed two cents per bushel lower to 2-3/4 cents higher, with Dec up 2-3/4 cents at $4.23.
Traders said Benson Quinn bought one million each of Dec and March and 500,000 July bushels. Atwood-Peavey bought 1.4 million Dec, they said.
MGE estimated Friday's wheat futures volume at 22.707 million bushels, up from 20.493 million on Thursday.
MGE March barley was the only barley future contract to trade. It closed up 1-1/2 cents per hundredweight at $7.12.
